p: Water retention properties were determined using water retention tests. Samples (CM and MFCM) with the same mass were dried and weighed. Samples were then immersed in PBS at 37 °C for 24 h, and the water on the surface was removed using filter paper. Samples were finally placed in plates at 37 °C and weighed after a specific incubation time [ 50]. The water retention capacity was calculated using the following equation: Water retention ratio (%) = Mi × 100/M 0 where M i and M 0 represent the percent of swelling at specific and initial time (maximum PBS swelling), respectively.
